title: Methods Book Template
text: Set book; function creates project specified path, renders demo book Quarto, opens book web browser, opens project new RStudio window. demo book gives examples features included book. Set custom red, white blue stripe top book (instead psyTeachR rainbow stripe).
code: library(booktem)  create_book(path = "demobook",              title = "My Demo Book",             author = "My Name") stripe_colors <- c(red = "red",                    white = "white",                    blue = "blue") stripe_css <- stripes(stripe_colors, height = 10)  create_book(path = "demobook",              title = "My Demo Book",             author = "My Name",             css = stripe_css)

title: Create a Template Book — create_book
code: create_book(   path = "book",   title = "Book Template",   subtitle = "",   author = "Me",   description = "Book Description",   output_dir = "docs",   license = "CC-BY",   google_analytics = "",   socials = list(),   repo_url = "",   repo_branch = "main",   repo_actions = "edit, issue, source",   downloads = "pdf, epub",   sharing = "twitter, facebook, linkedin",   margin_header = "",   footer = paste(license, format(Sys.Date(), "%Y"), ",", author),   light_theme = "flatly",   dark_theme = "darkly",   css = stripes(),   df_print = "kable",   webexercises = TRUE,   open = rlang::is_interactive(),   render = TRUE )

title: Create a Template Book — create_book
text: path path location book machine title title book subtitle subtitle book author author book description short description book output_dir directory render output license license add (CC-now) google_analytics google analytics address socials list social media URLs put footer, named relevant icon (see Details) repo_url github repo URL (e.g., "myusername/mybook") repo_branch branch use (usually "main" "master") repo_actions github repo links add right sidebar downloads download types include sharing "twitter, facebook, linkedin" margin_header defaults "" footer defaults "license YEAR, author" light_theme "flatly" (see https://quarto.org/docs/output-formats/html-themes.html) dark_theme "darkly" css custom styles (e.g., stripes() creates signature PsyTeachR rainbow stripes) df_print print tables (default, kable, tibble, paged) webexercises whether use webexercises interactive exercises open whether activate new project RStudio render whether render quarto book opening

title: Colour Stripes CSS — stripes
code: # default PsyTeachR colours stripes() #> /* named colours */ #> :root { #>   --pink: #983E82; #>   --orange: #E2A458; #>   --yellow: #F5DC70; #>   --green: #59935B; #>   --blue: #467AAC; #>   --purple: #61589C; #> } #>  #> /* rainbow borders */ #> body { #>   margin-top: 18px; #>   box-shadow: #>     0 -3px 0 0px var(--purple), #>     0 -6px 0 0px var(--blue), #>     0 -9px 0 0px var(--green), #>     0 -12px 0 0px var(--yellow), #>     0 -15px 0 0px var(--orange), #>     0 -18px 0 0px var(--pink); #> }  # red, yellow and blue thick stripes stripes(c(red = "red", yellow = "yellow", blue = "blue"), 10) #> /* named colours */ #> :root { #>   --red: red; #>   --yellow: yellow; #>   --blue: blue; #> } #>  #> /* rainbow borders */ #> body { #>   margin-top: 30px; #>   box-shadow: #>     0 -10px 0 0px var(--blue), #>     0 -20px 0 0px var(--yellow), #>     0 -30px 0 0px var(--red); #> }
